thread.title: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury
thread.title_full: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury

title: Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury
text:
Updated: 4:12 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Posted: 4:12 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 Cubs SS Russell ruled out for NLCS with hamstring injury Related View Larger Chicago Cubs' Addison Russell, right, talks to a trainers after hitting a triple against the St. Louis Cardinals during the fourth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) Sponsored Links The Associated Press CHICAGO â€” 
Cubs shortstop Addison Russell will not play in the NL Championship Series because of a strained left hamstring. 
Manager Joe Maddon also says Jon Lester will start the series opener on Saturday night, followed by Jake Arrieta in Game 2 on Sunday. Lester is 6-5 with a 2.66 ERA in 15 career postseason games, including 13 starts. 
The Cubs will find out their opponent for the next round when the Dodgers host the New York Mets in Game 5 of their division series on Thursday night. 
Russell left Game 3 of the NLDS against the Cardinals due to tightness in his left hamstring. Maddon says it's a moderate strain, and the team will be pragmatic with the injury. 
Javier Baez, who replaced Russell after he left in the previous round, will be the starting shortstop in the NLCS. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
